Replace.Text: +{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Commercial Hub district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Suguba district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] Science from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Government Plaza.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Government Plaza.
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] Science from the adjacent Government Plaza.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from the adjacent Government Plaza.
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Government Plaza.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Diplomatic Quarter.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Diplomatic Quarter.
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] Science from the adjacent Diplomatic Quarter.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from the adjacent Diplomatic Quarter.
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Diplomatic Quarter.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Oasis.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Luxury resource.
A district for naval activity in your city. No [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking. Must be built on Coast or Lake adjacent to land. Cannot be built on Reef.
A district in your city dedicated to keeping your people happy. Cannot be built in a city with Water Park district.

A district placed on water dedicated to keeping your people happy. Must be built on Coast or Lake adjacent to land. Cannot be built in a city with Entertainment Complex district. Cannot be built on Reef.
A district that provides up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing based on Appeal.
A district for protecting natural environment. Grants up to 3 [ICON_Housing] Housing based on Appeal. Culture bombs adjacent neutral tiles.
A district placed once in your empire to commemorate your government choices. Provides +8 Loyalty per turn to this city. Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

A district placed once in your empire to facilitate international diplomacy. Grants +1 [ICON_FAVOR] Diplomatic Favor for each Delegation or Embassy from other civilizations. Awards +1 [ICON_Envoy] Envoy. Enemy Spies operate at 2 levels below normal when targeting this district or adjacent districts.
A district that is required to construct the Science Victory projects. Cannot be built on Hills.

A district that provides extra fresh water from adjacent water source. Cities with existing fresh water get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and other cities get +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing, in addition to full [ICON_Housing] Housing from fresh water. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if adjacent to Geothermal Fissure. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought.

A district built on Floodplains to improve the comfort of living along this river. Cities get full [ICON_Housing] Housing from fresh water if built adjacent to City Center. Prevents damage from flooding of this river (though yields from flooding drop by 50%). Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought.

A district built on flat land to connect two bodies of water or a body of water to City Center. Cities get full [ICON_Housing] Housing from fresh water if built adjacent to City Center. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought.
Provides +2 Loyalty per turn in this city. If this city has maximum Loyalty, also provides extra +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Food] Food if you own [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, [ICON_RESOURCE_MAIZE] Maize, [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep, or [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle.

+1 [ICON_Food] Food on [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, [ICON_RESOURCE_MAIZE] Maize, [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep, and [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle for this city. Must be built in a city adjacent to River.
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if the city has Aqueduct, Dam, or Canal district built adjacent to City Center.
Protects Coastal Lowland in this city from flooding. Flooded tiles can be fully repaired, but submerged tiles are never recoverable. Must be built in a city with Coastal Lowland.
Provides district defenses and [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strikes ability to City Center and Encampment district.[NEWLINE]Provides 1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after Conservation Civic.
Increases the strength of district defenses. This city is not affected by Battering Rams.[NEWLINE]Provides 2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after Conservation Civic.
Increases the strength of district defenses. This city is not affected by Siege Towers or Battering Rams.[NEWLINE]Provides 3 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after Conservation Civic.

Grants +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to adjacent Charming tiles. Increased to +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for adjacent Breathtaking tiles without improvements.

Grants +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent Charming tiles. Increased to +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for adjacent Breathtaking tiles without improvements.
Allows purchasing Missionaries with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Allows purchasing Apostles, Gurus, and Inquisitors with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Missionary and Apostles purchased here can spread Religion 1 extra time.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not have Lighthouse building.
Bonus [ICON_Production] Production extends to each City Center within 6 tiles.

Converts [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal into [ICON_Power] Power as necessary for cities within 6 tiles each turn, at the rate of 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal [ICON_PowerRight] 4 [ICON_Power] Power.[NEWLINE]Causes heavy CO2 emission into the atmosphere.

Converts [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] Oil into [ICON_Power] Power as necessary for cities within 6 tiles each turn, at the rate of 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] Oil [ICON_PowerRight] 4 [ICON_Power] Power.[NEWLINE]Bonus [ICON_Production] Production extends to all City Centers within 6 tiles.[NEWLINE]Causes Moderate CO2 emission into the atmosphere.

Converts [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] Uranium into [ICON_Power] Power as necessary for cities within 6 tiles each turn, at the rate of 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] Uranium [ICON_PowerRight] 16 [ICON_Power] Power.[NEWLINE]Bonus [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Science] Science extends to all City Centers within 6 tiles.[NEWLINE]Causes minor CO2 emission into the atmosphere. There is a chance for a Nuclear Accident to occur, which increases as the reactor ages.
Provides +4 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable water sources.
+1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after Conservation Civic.
Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenity extends to each City Center within 6 tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science on Rainforest and Marsh for this city.
+2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism.
Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenity extends to each City Center within 9 tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science on coastal resources and Reef for this city.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each City Center within 6 tiles.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city [ICON_CITIZEN] Population is 10 or higher and +4 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city [ICON_CITIZEN] Population is 20 or higher.
Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each City Center within 9 tiles.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each Wonder built in this city on or adjacent to Coast.
+25% combat experience for all melee and ranged units trained in this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed).
+25% combat experience for all cavalry and siege units trained in this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed).
+25% combat experience for all land units trained in this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed).
+25% combat experience for all land units trained in this city. Allows Corps and Armies to be trained directly (-25% cost).[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed).

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on Coast for this city. +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if this city is adjacent to Coast.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not have Market building.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +5, if this city does not have Barracks or Stable building (on Standard Speed).

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on Reef for this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +5, if this city does not have Armory building (on Standard Speed).

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Allows Fleets and Armadas to be trained directly (-25% cost).[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold on Coast for this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +5, if this city does not have Military Academy building (on Standard Speed).
+25% combat experience for air units trained in this city. +1 air unit slot.
+50% combat experience for air units trained in this city. +1 air unit slot.[NEWLINE]Can transport land units after Rapid Deployment Civic.

+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities and +4 [ICON_Housing] Housing in Cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors.[NEWLINE]This city can build one more district than the [ICON_Citizen] Population limit allows.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
New cities receive 1 Builder and start with 3 additional tiles.[NEWLINE]50% increased [ICON_Production] Production toward Settlers in this City.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

Capturing an enemy City grants 20% bonus [ICON_Production] Production in all Cities for 5 turns.[NEWLINE]This bonus is increased to 50% for this city.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

+4 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor. Leveraging City States costs half [ICON_Gold] Gold. City State units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if you are the City State's Suzerain (including Leveraged Units).[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
+1 Spy and Spy capacity. All Spy Operations have a higher chance of success.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Grants the ability to purchase land combat units with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
All units heal up to 20 points when they eliminate a unit.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Provides 4 slots for any Great Work. Enemies receive 50% more war weariness from fighting against you.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Builders gain the ability to use all of their charges to provide bonus [ICON_Production] Production to district projects. Once per city per turn.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
+2 Influence Points per turn. Enemy Spies operate at 1 level below normal when targeting this city or cities with Encampments.
+3 Influence Points per turn. Capturing or killing enemy Spy grants 100 [ICON_Science] Science (on Standard Speed) for every level.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Farms.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Grassland or Plains.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Mines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Hills or valid resources.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Quarries.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on valid resources.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Fishing Boats.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on valid resources.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Pastures.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on valid resources.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Camps.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on valid resources.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Plantations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on valid resources.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Lumber Mills.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Woods or Rainforest.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Oil Wells.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on land with [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] Oil.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Offshore Oil Rigs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast or Lake with [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] Oil.

Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct Forts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production if the city has a garrisoned unit.
Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct Airstrips.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can support 2 air units.[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat land.
Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct Missile Siloes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Acts as a launch site for Nuclear and Thermonuclear Devices.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Fisheries.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food for every adjacent sea resource.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct City Parks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if adjacent to water.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built adjacent to another City Park.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Ski Resorts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [Icon_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism for every adjacent Mountain (Grassland, Plains, Tundra, or Snow), Woods, Entertainment Complex district, Water Park district, and Beach Resort.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Mountain (Grassland, Plains, Tundra, or Snow). Cannot be built adjacent to another Ski Resort. Cannot be pillaged or removed.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Seaside Resorts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism equal to Appeal.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Grassland, Plains, or Desert without Hills adjacent to Coast. Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking.

Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct a Mountain Tunnel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can transport land units at cost of 2 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Mountain. Cannot be pillaged or removed.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Wind Farms.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable wind sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built adjacent to Coast.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Offshore Wind Farms.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable wind sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built on Ocean.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast, Lake or Ocean.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Solar Farms.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable solar sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built on Desert.[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat land.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Geothermal Plants.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable geothermal sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built on Geothermal Fissure.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Geothermal Fissure or Volcanic Soil.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Seasteads.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production for every adjacent Fishing Boats. Fishing Boats receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every adjacent Seastead.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Offshore Wind Farm.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for every adjacent Reef.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast, Lake or Ocean. Cannot be built adjacent to another Seastead.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Bateys.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every adjacent Bonus resource and Entertainment Complex district (increased to +2 [Icon_Culture] Culture after Exploration Civic).[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat land. Cannot be built adjacent to another Batey.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Moais.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent Moai (increased to +1 [Icon_Culture] Culture for every adjacent Moai after Medieval Faires Civic).[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture if on or adjacent to Volcanic Soil.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to Coast or Lake.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Plains, Grassland, or Volcanic Soil. Cannot be built adjacent to Woods or Rainforest.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Alcázars.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_SCIENCE] Science equal to 50% of Appeal.[NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production if the city has a garrisoned unit.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built adjacent to another Alcázar.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Monasteries.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increases healing by 15 points for religious unit.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for every 2 adjacent districts.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing after Colonialism Civic.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built adjacent to another Monastery.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Colossal Heads.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every 2 adjacent Rainforest (increased to +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Rainforest after Humanism Civic).[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every 2 adjacent Woods (increased to +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Woods after Humanism Civic).[NEWLINE][ICON_TOURISM] Tourism equal to [ICON_FAITH] Faith output after Flight Technology.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Snow.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Nazca Lines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles with resource.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food to adjacent Desert after Civil Service Civic.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to adjacent flat land after Mass Production Technology.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Desert without Hills. Cannot be worked.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Mahaviharas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Holy Site district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus district (increased to +2 [Icon_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus district after Scientific Theory Technology).[NEWLINE]Awards 1 random technology when built for the first time.[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat land. Cannot be built adjacent to another Mahavihara.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Cahokia Mounds.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for cities with Cahokia Mound.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for cities with 2 Cahokia Mounds after Natural History Civic.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 2 adjacent district after Feudalism Civic (increased to +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent district after Replaceable Parts Technology).[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing after Cultural Heritage Civic.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built adjacent to another Cahokia Mound.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Trading Domes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Luxury resource.[NEWLINE]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Trading Dome in the origin city.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built adjacent to another Trading Dome.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Châteaus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every adjacent wonder (increased to +2 [Icon_Culture] Culture for every adjacent wonder after Flight Technology).[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to River.[NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to Bonus or Luxury resource. Cannot be built adjacent to another Château.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Chemamulls.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to 75% of Appeal.[NEWLINE]Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking.

Unlocks the Nau ability to construct Feitorias.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade routes sent to this city from Portugal provide +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast or Lake adjacent to Land and Bonus or Luxury resource in territory belonging to other civilizations or City-States that you have Open Borders with. Cannot be built adjacent to another Feitoria. Cannot be removed.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Golf Courses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to City Center. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to Entertainment Complex district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing after Globalization Civic.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Desert. One per city and cannot be swapped.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Great Walls.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [Icon_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Great Wall.[NEWLINE]+2 [Icon_Culture] Culture for every adjacent Great Wall after Castles Technology.[NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production if the city has a garrisoned unit.[NEWLINE]Must be built in line along border of your empire. Can only be pillaged (never destroyed) by natural disasters.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Haciendas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food for every 2 adjacent Plantation (increased to +1 [ICON_Food] Food for every adjacent Plantation after Replaceable Parts Technology).[NEWLINE]Plantations and Haciendas receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every 2 adjacent Hacienda (increased to +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every adjacent Hacienda after Rapid Deployment Civic).[NEWLINE]Must be built on Grassland or Plains.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Ice Hockey Rinks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each adjacent Tundra and Snow.[NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to Stadium building.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production after Professional Sports Civic.[NEWLINE]Ski Resorts receive +1 [Icon_Gold] Gold for every Ice Hocky Rink.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Tundra or Snow. One per city and cannot be swapped.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Kampungs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each adjacent Fishing Boats.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing after Mass Production Technology.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production after Civil Engineering Civic.[NEWLINE][ICON_TOURISM] Tourism equal to [ICON_Food] Food output after Flight Technology.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast or Lake adjacent to sea resource.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Kurgans.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Pasture (increased to +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Pasture after Stirrups Technology).[NEWLINE][ICON_TOURISM] Tourism equal to [ICON_FAITH] Faith output after Flight Technology.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Mekewaps.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold if adjacent to Luxury resource.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 2 adjacent Bonus Resource (increased to +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent Bonus Resource after Conservation Civic).[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing after Civil Service Civic.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every adjacent Luxury resource after Cartography Technology.[NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to Bonus or Luxury resource. Cannot be built adjacent to another Mekewap.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Missions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOod] Food, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if on different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus and Holy Site district.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science after Cultural Heritage Civic.[NEWLINE]+2 Loyalty per turn for cities with Mission adjacent to City Center and on different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Nubian Pyramids.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production if adjacent to City Center.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every adjacent Theater Square district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Holy Site district.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Commercial Hub district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production for every adjacent Industrial Zone district.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Desert.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Open-Air Museums.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 Loyalty per turn in this city.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each type of terrain (Grassland, Plains, Desert, Tundra, and Snow) on which at least one Swedish city is settled.[NEWLINE]One per city and cannot be swapped.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Outback Stations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food for every adjacent Pasture.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every adjacent Pasture after Stem Power Technology.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every 2 adjacent Outback Stations after Steam Power Technology.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food for every 2 adjacent Outback Stations after Rapid Deployment Civic.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Grassland or Plains without Hills, or Desert.

Unlocks the Toa ability to construct Pās.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production if the city has a garrisoned unit.[NEWLINE]Occupying Māori unit heals even if they just moved or attacked.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Pairidaezas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for every adjacent Holy Site and Theater Square district.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every adjacent City Center and Commercial Hub district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture after Diplomatic Service Civic.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Tundra or Snow. Cannot be built adjacent to another Pairidaeza.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Polders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent Polder (increased to +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent Polder after Replaceable Parts Technology).[NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold after Civil Engineering Civic.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production for every adjacent Polder after Replaceable Parts Technology.[NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_Movement] Movement Cost to 3.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Coast or Lake adjacent to 3 or more passable land tiles.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Qhapaq Ñans.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can transport land units at cost of 2 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Mountain. Cannot be pillaged or removed.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Rock-Hewn Churches.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Mountain and Hills.[NEWLINE][ICON_TOURISM] Tourism equal to [ICON_FAITH] Faith output after Flight Technology.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Hills or Volcanic Soil. Cannot be built adjacent to another Rock-Hewn Church. Can only be pillaged (never destroyed) by natural disasters.

Unlocks the Roman Legion ability to construct Roman Forts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production if the city has a garrisoned unit.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Sphinxes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith if adjacent to wonder.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if on Floodplains.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold after Natural History Civic.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Snow. Cannot be built adjacent to another Sphinx.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Stepwells.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to Farm.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if adjacent to Holy Site district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith after Feudalism Civic.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing after Sanitation Technology.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food after Professional Sports Civic.[NEWLINE]Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Hills. Cannot be built adjacent to another Stepwell.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Terrace Farms.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent Mountain.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every adjacent Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production if adjacent to Fresh Water and not Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 2 adjacent Terrace Farm after Feudalism Civic (increased to +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent Terrace Farm after Replaceable Parts Technology).[NEWLINE]Must be built on Grassland Hills, Plains Hills, or Desert Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Ziggurats.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to River.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold after Natural History Civic.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Hills.
+1 Military policy slot. Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and 2 turns of fortification. Must be built on Hills adjacent to Encampment district.

+20% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and 10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all cities. these yields are doubled for cities that own 5 Snow tiles within 3 tiles. Must be built on Snow adjacent to Campus district.
+1 [ICON_Citizen] Population in all current cities when completed. +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing in all cities. Must be built adjacent to Aqueduct district.
+2 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys when you build a wonder in this city, including this wonder. Must be built adjacent to [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
+1 Economic policy slot. +50% [ICON_Gold] Gold on current treasury. Must be built adjacent to River and Commercial Hub district with Bank building.

+100% [ICON_POWER] Power for all renewable sources. These sources provide [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism equal to their [ICON_POWER] Power output. +1 Appeal to tiles adjacent to Rainforest and Marsh in your empire. Must be built adjacent to Neighborhood district.
Grants 1 free [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and awards 2 random civics when completed. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Theater Square district.
+20% [ICON_Culture] Culture in this city, and triggers the Inspiration moment for 1 random civic from the Atomic era. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Theater Square district.

Awards 3 [ICON_Governor] Governor titles. All cities not on your [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor gain +15% [ICON_Production] Production, +15% [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +15% [ICON_Gold] Gold. Must be built adjacent to Government Plaza.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Rainforest in your empire. Extra +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture on Rainforest for this city. Must be built on Rainforest.
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 Loyalty per turn, and +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities to each City Center within 6 tiles. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Entertainment Complex with Arena building.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Cities with both Market and Lighthouse building gain +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Grants 1 Trader. Must be built on Coast adjacent to land and Harbor district.

Religious [ICON_Tourism] Tourism effects are not diminished by other civilizations with The Enlightenment Civic. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from Seaside Resorts in your empire. Must be built on Hills.
All tiles in your empire gain +2 Appeal. Must be built on flat land adjacent to City Center.
+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in all cities. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Entertainment Complex district with Stadium building.

+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on Marsh in your empire. +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on Floodplains for this city. Must be built on Floodplains or Marsh.
+1 Wildcard policy slot. Must be built on flat land adjacent to City Center.

This wonder acts as Modern Road that bridges adjacent land tiles. All tiles in this city gain +4 Appeal. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from improvements and National Parks in this city. Must be built on Coast where two land tiles on the opposite sides can be legally connected.

Prevents damage from flooding of this river (though yields from flooding drop by 50%). Floodplains in this city gain +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for each time flood damage is mitigated. Must be built on Floodplains.

Triggers the Eureka moments for all technologies from the Ancient and Classical era. Triggers the Eureka moment for 1 random technology after another civilization recruits a [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Campus district with Library building.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval and embarked units. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admirals. Must be built on Coast adjacent to land and Harbor district.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every Bonus resource this city owns within 3 tiles. Must be built adjacent to [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle and Commercial Hub district with Market building.
Missionaries and Apostles can spread Religion 1 extra time. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Holy Site district, and you must have founded a Religion.
City growth rate is 15% higher in all cities. Must be built adjacent to River.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from each [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art in your empire. Must be built adjacent to River.

+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for each Lake within 1 tile of this wonder. +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on Lake in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Food] Food on Lake for this city. Must be built on Lake adjacent to land.
Awards 6 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron per turn. +2 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to each City Center within 6 tiles. Must be built on Desert Hills.

+3 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys when completed. When you are the Suzerain of a City-State, this city receives +15% bonus of its yield type. If you are the Suzerain of 2 or more City-States of same yield type, all cities receive extra +15% bonus. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Coast.
+20% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city, and grants 4 Warrior Monks. Must be built adjacent to Holy Site district with Temple building.
Mountains provide standard adjacency bonus to Commercial Hub, Theater Square, and Industrial Zone districts. Must be built on Mountain without Volcano.
+2 Diplomatic Victory Points, and grants 2 Apostles. Must be built on Woods adjacent to Holy Site district with Temple building, and you must have founded a Religion.

[ICON_GREATENGINEER] Great Engineers have 1 extra charge. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith on Coast in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on Coast for this city. Must be built adjacent to Harbor district.

Grants 2 Gurus. Gurus are 30% cheaper to purchase. Religious units adjacent to Gurus gain +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. Must be built adjacent to Holy Site and you must have founded a Religion.

All Apostles gain Martyr promotion in addition to a second promotion you choose normally. Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and 2 turns of fortification. Must be built on Floodplains or Marsh.
Patronage of Great People costs 25% less [ICON_Faith] Faith. Districts in this city provide +2 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points of their type. Must be built on Hills.
+100% [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn from being the Suzerain of a City-State. Must be built adjacent to River.
+20% [ICON_Science] Science in this city, and awards 2 random technologies when completed. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Campus district with University building.

This wonder acts as Canal district, and 1 or 2 adjacent Canal districts are also constructed. Provides +5 [ICON_Gold] Gold to all cities that has Canal district built adjacent to City Center. Must be built on flat land where this wonder and the adjacent Canal districts can legally connect two bodies of water or a body of water to City Center.

+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on Desert without Floodplains in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold on Desert without Floodplains for this city. Must be built on Desert without Hills.
+1 Diplomatic policy slot. +1 Diplomatic Victory point. Must be built on Hills adjacent to Mountain.
Grants 1 Builder. All Builders can build 1 extra time. Must be built on Desert without Hills.

+20% [ICON_Production] Production in this city, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on Mines and Quarries for this city. Must be built adjacent to River and Industrial Zone district with Factory building.

+100% [ICON_Tourism] Religious Tourism from this city. +1 [ICON_Food] Food on Tundra in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on Tundra for this city. Must be built adjacent to City Center.
+3 Diplomatic Victory Points. When in Golden Age, each of your [ICON_Citizen] Citizens exerts extra 0.5 Loyalty pressure in their city. Must be built on Coast adjacent to land and Harbor district.

Grants 3 Archers, 3 Spearmen, and 1 Battering Ram. +30% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards anti-cavalry units. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Encampment district with Barracks or Stable building.
Grants 1 free [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet. Must be built on flat land adjacent to [ICON_RESOURCE_STONE] Stone.
Must be built on Coast adjacent to Theater Square district.
+1 Era Score from Historic Moment if that Moment is usually worth 2 or more Era Score. Must be built adjacent to River.
Each Camp, Pasture, and Plantation within 4 tiles provides +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity. Must be built adjacent to Camp.

All current units gain a promotion level when completed. All Archaeologists can enter foreign territory without Open Borders. Must be built on flat land adjacent to Encampment district with Barracks or Stable building.

+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold on Breathtaking tiles in your empire. All founded cities not on your [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent receive a City Center building with the lowest cost when completed. Must be built on Coast adjacent to land and Harbor district.

Foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to this city provide +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for them. +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for every [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to this city. Domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to this city provide extra +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to this city. Must be built on Desert adjacent to Campus district.
Receive a second naval unit each time you train a naval unit. Must be built on Coast adjacent to Industrial Zone district.
